column4: All other apps work though. I might add apt-get is not working on there, either.
apt-get does not work, Aemaeth. Thanks for your help so far. Any suggestions?
Is the comp's HDD bad?
All the other apps work.
Hold on. Let me try to run it again on the other computer...
OK. Back.
It's a notebook, so it's right beside me.
The disk is clicking, and wait a second, please...
OK. Have the errors.
E: Read error - read (5: Input/output error).
if your disk is clicking.. backup your data if you have any.. the drive may be dying
E: The package lists or status file could not be parsed or opened.
I did a fsck on startup with shutdown -rF now.
So I don't know... is the drive bad?
Right. I know that.
I thought it might be a file system error.
Thanks for helping so far. May I ask one more question: Can I fix the bad sectors?
Can Linux remap bad sectors on the drive? It's an older one. :)
Seriously. I know Win95 can do something like this.
Seriously? That bad?
clicking means hardware failure.. not bad sectors..
new drives are cheap..
